intro: Deckera rubiginosa, commonly known as the redroot germander, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and showy pink to red flowers. The plant is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woods. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Deckera rubiginosa is also known for its medicinal properties, though it is generally considered toxic to humans and animals.
